title: OCE RIOT CREW IM NOT HAPPY!

replies.body:
Twisted Treeline 3v3's are available weekly at the following times:
> #Twisted Treeline

>Tuesday: 3:00pm - 1:00am AEST
Wednesday: 3:00pm - 1:00am AEST
Thursday: 3:00pm - 1:00am AEST

For more information about the queue schedule(s), check out this announcement:
http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/VdoPT9GX-queue-schedule

Why isn't it a permanent map like it's always been since LoL launched?

Or have i missed some development change in the last couple of years of not playing and Riot have put it on a queue schedule to free up server loads etc?

I can understand the demands may be higher on weekends for server loads and its easier to dedicate them mostly towards the rift and ranked....

but still... 

sad panda.... mid-week after school specials for the young ones...

nice move Riot... nice move. Like who you're directing things towards.

Our queues have been this way for a while. There's simply not enough players on OCE to warrant having all maps open at once. This is why we have TT on at certain times. If you would like to play it at any time, you can purchase a server move to NA.

> [{quoted}](name=Ristretto,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=h1sEIaWH,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-01T22:57:22.382+0000)
>
> Our queues have been this way for a while. There's simply not enough players on OCE to warrant having all maps open at once. This is why we have TT on at certain times. If you would like to play it at any time, you can purchase a server move to NA.

i may actually, my ping is only 80ms there anyways, no difference in the game really. Something to think about.

Not enough of a mature gaming player base on OCE

I started here on OCE but transferred to NA and found that to actually be a very usual explanation when I ask other Australians why they're on NA (the maturity, also friends that play on NA is common too). 80 MS ping on NA? Please, share your witchcraft >_>. 220ms here :c.

> [{quoted}](name=Ristretto,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=h1sEIaWH,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-01T23:25:54.299+0000)
>
> I started here on OCE but transferred to NA and found that to actually be a very usual explanation when I ask other Australians why they're on NA (the maturity, also friends that play on NA is common too). 80 MS ping on NA? Please, share your witchcraft >_>. 220ms here :c.

protips for maximising your connection in Australia, do your searches online with your ISP distrubtion boxes in your area, you may be using a service which is a "far" (like 2km or so) from you, which has the line connected to every other house also. 

Me, i found that TPG had a distribution box for ADSL2 only 300m away from my building, i scanned my building and the street for wifi connections to see who was using what company, i found only 2 people had TPG between the distribution line and my house, in short. I get less traffic between, its only minimal, but even on csgo, i connect with 5ms and im using a jbhifi $500 laptop (potato in real gaming terms).

I torret at up to 2.4mbs download and i can download directly off bnet at 6-7mb per sec. Valve, i find im around 2.2mb, it is server related obviously, those speeds aren't available with everything, but i find i consistantly get 1.9-2.2mb downloads across the board, my connection to gaming is fairly solid. I checked WoW on my old account on US servers to see and even thats sitting on 80-100ms. 

I haven't tried 20+ players in FPS for US/EU servers, i'd still say stick with OCE servers for playable connections. 

And.... 

Dont use wifi, it may say its ok... you still lose some data connection,

use your ethernet cable as much as possible
How do you still not know the schedule....

> [{quoted}](name=Roguestoney,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=h1sEIaWH,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-05-01T23:42:24.085+0000)
>
> How do you still not know the schedule....

my first account was on NA just as OCE was released, quit a couple of years back but left it open for mates. Been stolen/banned, unsure. Riot won't let me recover it, i can't complain i know i broke the rules etc. 

Made this one *thinks* about 6 weeks ago now, so it never dawned on me till Hexakill came out that Twisted Treeline was gone and i actually used to really like the map.

Didn't realize we all had the same situations in life and we should all know the same things.

Anything else i'm missing that you feel should obviously be common knowledge?

> [{quoted}](name=ToTaL ViRGiN,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=h1sEIaWH,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-05-02T02:38:03.446+0000)

>

Crys on forums. Doesn't even look at the skickied thread first titled "queue schedules" common sense is hard.

love the salty attitude kid, do you realize you're an oxymoron and that riot staff have already dealt with it?

I wasn't aware that a standard map had a schedule.

Guess you didn't bother reading the thread properly either. 


Don't throw stones when you're in a glass house.
